title: There Are Some Absolutely Shit Hot Phone Deals Going On Right Now Just FYI
text:
That feeling you get when your old phone is about to kick the bucket. You know what I’m talking about, right?

If you’re jonesing for an upgrade, the good news is, now is a really good time to bag a new one. The telcos have been flinging deals at us left, right and centre this month, so let’s dive on into the best of the bunch.

Best deals for the iPhone 11 and iPhone 11 Pro

Optus, the sly old dog, is up to its usual tricks. The telco is shelling out a cool 100GB of data with the new iPhone 11 and iPhone 11 Pro on promo plans. (Try saying that three times fast.) The plans shown above are on a 36-month contract, which means your wallet takes less of a hit every month.

Here are some more plans for the iPhone 11. Some will go for 24 months and some will go for 36 months:

And here are some more plans for the iPhone 11 Pro. Again, some will go for 24 months and some will go for 36 months:

Best deals for the Samsung Galaxy S10

Yet again, another promo plan from Optus is dishing out an insane amount of data – 80GB for $79 per month on a 36-month contract. But Telstra has got a tempting offer too – $288 off the Samsung Galaxy S10 over the life of any plans, including this 36-month plan.

And whether you choose Optus or Telstra, or even Vodafone for your S10 plan, you’ll score a bonus pair of Galaxy Buds valued at $249. Not too shabby, guys.

Here are some more plans for the Samsung Galaxy S10. Some will go for 24 months and some will go for 36 months:

Best deals for the Google Pixel 4

The Pixel 4 is so hot off the presses at the Google factory that you can’t get one in your hands just yet, but it is available for pre-order and can be found in the wild from Thursday 24 October.

Optus has got its 100GB promo offer running on so many phone plans that, by now, you’re probably sick of hearing about it, which is why we’ve thrown in this deal from Vodafone as well. For $74.13 per month over 36 months, you’ll get a Google Pixel 4 plus 30GB of data. And if you chew through all of that before the end of the month, Vodafone will give you unlimited data to use – it’ll just be slow data. But hey, better than no data, right?

Both plans come with bonus tech because apparently that’s just a thing that happens now when new phones come out. Choose the Optus plan and you’ll get a bonus Harman/Kardon Citation ONE Bluetooth speaker valued at $299. Choose the Vodafone plan and get a bonus JBL Link 10 Wireless Portable Speaker valued at $229.
